titleStmt.title: T. J. Puryear et al to James F. Robinson
CWG12184

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 1st - 20th Regiments Kentucky Infantry Primary Source Documents
msIdentifier.idno: Box 8, Folder Box 8, Folder 20th Ky. Inf. - Misc

body.p: We Union men neighbors & acquiantances of Capt L. B. Waller commanding Co 20 Ky Regt infantry would say that he volunteered early in the present rebellion and as we have learned honorably and Efficiently discharged his duties that he is an Efficient officer and deserves promotion and we earnestly solicity your Excellency to avail the first aportunitiy to promate a young brave and efficient officer

T. J. Puryear
W A Turner
E. C. White
J J McIntosh
M, W, Williams
Lucian Anderson
J R Beadles
J F Bolinger
W E Blount
Wm Beadles
Wm A Mayfield
Thos F Beadles

Military recomg
Capt T. B. Wallce of Kenty Regt for promotion

Brig. Gen. John W. Finnell
A. Gen Ky vols
Frankfort
Ky

Recmmng Capt Wallace for promn
20th Inf:
Comms issd &c as within
